node.description:
# üìñ README

The travel planning system is a smart setup that uses several specialized Agent components to help plan incredible trips. Imagine each agent as a travel expert focusing on a part of your journey. Here's how it works:
Each agent has a role defined in the **Agent Instructions** and relevant **Tools** attached. The user submits a query through the **Chat Input**, and the three agents create a complete travel plan based on the user's query.

## Quickstart
1. Add your **OpenAI API Key** to each Agent.
2. Add your **Search API** key to the Search API component.
2. Run the flow in the **Playground**.

data.description: Load and retrieve data from specified URLs. Supports output in plain text, raw HTML, or JSON, with options for cleaning and separating multiple outputs.

node.description: Fetch content from one or more web pages, following links recursively.

autoset_encoding.info: If enabled, automatically sets the encoding of the request.
autoset_encoding.name: autoset_encoding

check_response_status.info: If enabled, checks the response status of the request.
check_response_status.name: check_response_status

continue_on_failure.info: If enabled, continues crawling even if some requests fail.
continue_on_failure.name: continue_on_failure

filter_text_html.info: If enabled, filters out text/css content type from the results.
filter_text_html.name: filter_text_html

format.info: Output Format. Use 'Text' to extract the text from the HTML or 'HTML' for the raw HTML content.
format.name: format

headers.info: The headers to send with the request
headers.name: headers

max_depth.info:
Controls how many 'clicks' away from the initial page the crawler will go:
- depth 1: only the initial page
- depth 2: initial page + all pages linked directly from it
- depth 3: initial page + direct links + links found on those direct link pages
Note: This is about link traversal, not URL path depth.
max_depth.name: max_depth

prevent_outside.info: If enabled, only crawls URLs within the same domain as the root URL. This helps prevent the crawler from going to external websites.
prevent_outside.name: prevent_outside

timeout.info: Timeout for the request in seconds.
timeout.name: timeout

tools_metadata.info: Modify tool names and descriptions to help agents understand when to use each tool.
tools_metadata.name: tools_metadata

urls.description: Enter one or more URLs to crawl recursively, by clicking the '+' button.
urls.title: Urls

value.display_description: Fetch content from one or more web pages, following links recursively.
value.name: fetch_content

value.display_description: Fetch content from one or more web pages, following links recursively.
value.name: as_message

urls.name: urls

use_async.info: If enabled, uses asynchronous loading which can be significantly faster but might use more system resources.
use_async.name: use_async

node.description: Define the agent's instructions, then enter a task to complete using tools.

add_current_date_tool.info: If true, will add a tool to the agent that returns the current date.
add_current_date_tool.name: add_current_date_tool

agent_description.info: The description of the agent. This is only used when in Tool Mode. Defaults to 'A helpful assistant with access to the following tools:' and tools are added dynamically. This feature is deprecated and will be removed in future versions.
agent_description.name: agent_description
agent_description.value: A helpful assistant with access to the following tools:

context_id.info: The context ID of the chat. Adds an extra layer to the local memory.
context_id.name: context_id

format_instructions.info: Generic Template for structured output formatting. Valid only with Structured response.
format_instructions.name: format_instructions
format_instructions.value: You are an AI that extracts structured JSON objects from unstructured text. Use a predefined schema with expected types (str, int, float, bool, dict). Extract ALL relevant instances that match the schema - if multiple patterns exist, capture them all. Fill missing or ambiguous values with defaults: null for missing values. Remove exact duplicates but keep variations that have different field values. Always return valid JSON in the expected format, never throw errors. If multiple objects can be extracted, return them all in the structured format.

handle_parsing_errors.info: Should the Agent fix errors when reading user input for better processing?
handle_parsing_errors.name: handle_parsing_errors

input_value.info: The input provided by the user for the agent to process.
input_value.name: input_value

max_iterations.info: The maximum number of attempts the agent can make to complete its task before it stops.
max_iterations.name: max_iterations

n_messages.info: Number of chat history messages to retrieve.
n_messages.name: n_messages

output_schema.info: Schema Validation: Define the structure and data types for structured output. No validation if no output schema.
output_schema.name: output_schema

table_schema.description: Specify the name of the output field.
table_schema.name: name

table_schema.description: Describe the purpose of the output field.
table_schema.name: description

table_schema.description: Indicate the data type of the output field (e.g., str, int, float, bool, dict).
table_schema.name: type

table_schema.description: Set to True if this output field should be a list of the specified type.
table_schema.name: multiple

system_prompt.info: System Prompt: Initial instructions and context provided to guide the agent's behavior.
system_prompt.name: system_prompt
system_prompt.value: You are a helpful assistant that can use tools to answer questions and perform tasks.

tools.info: These are the tools that the agent can use to help with tasks.
tools.name: tools

agent_llm.info: The provider of the language model that the agent will use to generate responses.
agent_llm.name: agent_llm
